E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	 And as many times as you draw anything out of him for any reason, wrap it in lead and tie it up.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	 And if it is prolonged, then you cut off a part of it and wrap the remainder; and do not cut it straight until it has been drawn out, for if you cut it straight, it constricts and enters into the flesh and causes an abscess and pus in that place and a bad ulcer.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	 Therefore, it is necessary that it be pulled gently and gradually until it is completely removed from him, and that nothing remains in his body.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	 And this vein is drawn out in some men to a length of five palms and ten fingers, and it has come to me that one was drawn out of twenty palms.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	 And if it is cut during the time of its treatment, then insert the ray into its wound and pierce it with a long incision through the body until all that is in the matter is evacuated, and administer putrefaction of the place for some days with medicines; and then treat it according to the cure for abscesses.
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	 And sometimes this vein has many branches, particularly when it reaches the joint of the foot or in the foot itself, and comes to each orifice, and exits from every orifice branch.
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	 And therefore cure it thus as we have said in the division and with that which has been mentioned above.
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	 About the cutting of worms generated under the skin, and it is called "bovine illness".
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	 This illness is called in some lands "bovine illness" because it often happens to cattle and it is a worm that is born between the skin and the flesh, and goes through all the body, ascending and descending, and shows its movement from member to member until it breaks the skin and comes out.
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	 And its generation is from the putrefaction of some humors, just like worms and snakes and earthworms and roundworms in the belly.
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	 And it is feared for its malice, because when it goes into the body and reaches the head, and arrives at the eye, then it quickly blows up in it and enters and destroys the eye, and this often happens.
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	 Therefore, when you want to cure that and extract it, do not do so unless by the sensation of its movement and appearance, and then it is necessary that you have something above it and something below it with a strong bandage and constriction, and then dry it out on top and extract it.
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	 And if it is inflamed in the flesh and you do not find anything there, then place a cautery with fire on the spot until death, and the main cause to be feared is corruption of it which corrupts the area as we have said.
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	 And if you see that it has reached the head near the eye, then strengthen the eyelid with a strong ligature, and dry it out, and extract it; and it is necessary for the patient to use purifying remedies for their body with medicines that evacuate putrid humors, and beware of foods that cause putrefaction.
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	 About the incision for pain in the nose.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	 This illness is called "nafir" in our land, and it is a pain that comes to certain members, and it also changes from member to member.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	 And I have seen this as I will now tell you.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	 I was called to a sick woman in a village, and I uncovered her arm and saw a small inflammation in the funis vein of the arm, and after it had been cut for an hour, I saw that inflammation move as if it were a worm going upward, but more slowly than a worm, as if it were quicksilver when it runs from place to place.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	 And then the pain will go away from that place and enter into the muscle, and here it stays for about an hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	 And then it moves to another part of the body until it reaches the other arm.
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	 And then I realized that it was circulating throughout the entire body, just as I had seen; and I was greatly amazed at the changes in him and the speed with which it moved from one limb to another.
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	 And I had already seen this in my own feet according to that manner, but I have rarely seen others whose pain is transferred from limb to limb.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	 But I did not see it in the same way with the feet as in the woman.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	 And I did not think it was anything other than that the woman was old, with dry body and open veins, and in this way she felt that wind moving around.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	 And it is necessary that this should not appear as a result of treatment in those who are delicate and have moist bodies with closed veins.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	 And when you want to treat him, and the patient feels that pain, then it is not apparent in the foot as we have said; then you should strengthen that [area] and gently and carefully press on it until that constricted wind has come out, and cauterize the area.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	 Here's a line-by-line translation of the given sentence:
De extraccio de sagetas.	 From the extraction of arrows.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	 Arrows are diverse according to their types and the parts of the body they strike, for their diversity lies in those that have large tips, small ones, concave, blunt, solid; and those with three angles; and those with tongues; and those with spikes.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	 And that which is according to the members and parts of the body it strikes is in two manners: for the members are either principal or secondary organs, such as the brain, heart, liver, lungs, kidneys, intestines, bladder, and similar organs; and therefore when it hits one of these members and you see signs of mortal danger (which I will explain later), then you must avoid extracting that arrow from those in whom death is most imminent. But when you do not see these bad signs and the arrow is not lodged deep within the member, then you may extract it and treat the wound.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	 And the signs of imminent death are when an arrow strikes someone and passes through the bone and exits from the fontanelle which is on top of the brain; for it causes severe headache, visual disturbance, vertigo, burning in the eyes, swelling and burning of the tongue, convulsions and clouding of consciousness, vomiting of bile, and a weak and severed speech, and white fluid similar to dust issues from the wound site, and the patient resembles someone with edema of the flesh.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	 When you see these signs, then you should abstain from the treatment and the removal of the arrow, unless it is necessary.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	 However, the signs of an arrow when it hits the heart are that it is near the left nipple, and you can feel that it is stuck in something hard, not something soft; and the movement of the arrow is similar to the pulse, and black blood comes from the wound, and there is coldness in the extremities, and a foul smell, and fainting; and thus you know that death approaches without doubt.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	 And the signs when the arrow has struck the lung are foaming blood from the wound, and the veins near the neck are swollen, and the patient's color changes, and there is rapid breathing or a strong desire to breathe cold air.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	 And if the arrow strikes the diaphragm, which is near the feet, then the pain is near the lower ribs, and there is great difficulty breathing with intense pain and sighing, and all the limbs' muscles do not move well.
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	 And if the arrow strikes the stomach, then undigested food will come out of the wound very quickly.
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	 And if the arrow hits the abdomen and is lodged in the patient, check for any opening or tear in the wound, such as the skin, tissue, or intestines that may be damaged, and do not expect a cure unless you remove the arrow.
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	 And if the arrow hits the bladder and urine is exiting from outside of the patient, and there is any sign of infection or swelling in the surrounding area, and the patient experiences severe pain, then you should know that it is fatal.
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	 However, the other members such as the face, neck, throat, shoulders, armpits, spine, collarbone, ribs, thighs and their respective parts of the body can be saved according to greater dispositions when the arrow does not strike a vein or artery and is not poisoned.
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	 I recommend this to you because I have seen the effect of these arrows, so that you may understand the treatment accordingly.
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	 The cause of this is that in one man, an arrow struck his lacrimal duct near the root of his nose, and I extracted it from the other side, leaving the arrowhead in his ear canal, and he was cured without any harm to his eye.
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	 And another arrow was extracted from a Jew, which had struck him in the gray of his eye, just below the eyelid, and the arrow was already hidden, and only a small tip remained attached to its shaft, and it was a large arrow of the sharp arrows of the Turks, with iron lion on which there were no feathers.
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	 And the Jew died, and it did not happen to him from a bad wound.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	 And another arrow was extracted from a Christian man, which had been shot into his throat, and it was an Arabic arrow, and it is the one with feathers; and then I cut along that between two bones, and it was already submerged in his throat; and then I was very careful with it, and I immediately extracted it, and the Christian was healed.
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	 And another arrow was extracted from a man who had been struck in the belly, and I thought he would die from it; and thus, after thirty days had passed and nothing changed in his condition, I cut along the arrow and pulled it out, and he was healed, and no bad accident happened to him.
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	 And I saw another man in whom an arrow had lodged in his back, and the wound had healed over it, and after seven years, the arrow came out by itself through the flesh of the body.
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	 And I saw a woman in whom an arrow had stuck in her belly, and the wound is healed inside, and it has not changed its position, and the woman does not suffer harm in any of her natural operations.
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	 And I saw another man in whom an arrow had stuck in his face and the wound is healed and the arrow is broken, not finding any pain here, and this has similar symptoms.
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	 And I extracted the arrow from the king's man who was stuck in the middle of his nose and had already deviated slightly to the right side, and the entire arrow was hidden.
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	 And I was called to care for him immediately after the arrow entered three days ago.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	 And then I found the arrow wound very narrow; and then I examined it with a fine probe, but did not feel it; however, he felt pain below his right ear, and then I suspected that this pain was due to the tip of the arrow.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	 And I covered the area with a plaster containing attracting and digestive virtues, intending that the place swell up so that the location of the arrow appears to me, so that it can be cut over it.
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	 And do not assume that the accident in that place is significant because an arrow has reached that place; and I continued with the plaster over him for many days, and no accident occurred; and the wound was healing in the meantime, and the patient was recovering from the extraction for many days, until one day he felt the arrow inside his nose and told me this.
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	 And then I applied a sharp, corrosive medicine to the wound for many days until it opened up, and with a probe, I searched for that, and found the subtle tip of the arrow, which was attached to the shaft.
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	 And then I adjusted the opening of the wound with that sharp medicine until the tip of the arrow became clearly visible to me, and it took four months for this to happen.
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	 And then because the wound was widened, and it became possible for me to insert the forceps into it, and they remained there without coming out, I did not cease trying and inventing on that with various devices until one day I began to pull it out with a properly made forceps, as will be shown in the form of those at the end of this chapter, until I extracted it; and then I restored that wound.
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	 And some doctors believed that the cartilage of the nose could not be restored, but I restored it and the wound has healed, and the patient is cured completely, with no aftereffects whatsoever.
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	 And I recommend to you the quality of extraction of some arrows, so that you may apply this rule and significance to what has not been said, for the divisions of this art and their definitions are not understood by simple narration nor do they comprehend those who read the books.
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	 And wise craftsmen compare with few words; and that which is present with that which is absent; and they discover new operations and new instruments from the descent of the strange causes of the art when it happens.
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	 And therefore I say that arrows are not expelled from the members in which they have entered except according to two methods: either by attraction of the place where it has entered, or by the contrary of the other side.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	 And that which is thrown by the place where it has entered, or is an arrow proceeding into a fleshy place, and it is pulled out and expelled.
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	 And if it does not obey the extraction in the hour when it falls, then you should leave it for some days until the flesh around it softens, and its attraction and exit are eased.
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	 And similarly, if the point is placed in the bone and does not obey you by coming out, then leave it there for a few days and apply a drawing and moistening ointment to it each day, until it comes out.
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	 And if it does not obey you by coming out after some days, then you must pierce around the tip of the arrow in that bone from all sides with a fine probe until the location is widened by the arrow, and then extract it.
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	 And if the arrow is stuck in the bone of the head and has proceeded into one of the ventricles of the brain, and some of those signs I mentioned appear in the patient, then abstain from extracting the arrow and leave it there until its being is equalized for a few days; because if the arrow reaches the cistern, death will not be prolonged.
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	 And if the arrow is stuck only in the body of the bone and does not pass into the cistern, and the patient remains for a few days without experiencing any of those signs, then you should endeavor to draw out the arrow and also to heal the patient.
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	 But if it is deeply lodged and does not obey you by coming out, then you should administer fine probes around the arrow as we have recommended, and then care for the area until it is healed.
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	 "However, if the arrow is already embedded in the body and is hidden from feeling, then you should investigate with your hand, and if you feel it, then remove it with suitable instruments for its extraction.
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta. Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment. Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	 Chapter Two: On Fractures When They Occur in the Head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	 There are many types of fractures, and their shapes are varied, and the causes are distinct, for some fractures are made by the blow of an axe, and the blow breaks all the bone into the cavity, which is beneath the bone, just as it happens in a log, and because of this, this type is called ascial; or the axe cuts off some part of the bone, and cuts the flesh of it but does not cut through to the other side; and this type of fracture is called levatio absoluta.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	 And the wound of these two fractures is either great or small, and the fracture that is crushed or bruised; and the cause of it is striking with a hammer or falling on a stone, and likewise.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	 And this fracture is either penetrating, approaching the skin near the bone; or it is on the surface of the bone, and the wound of these two fractures is either great or small.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	 And it is a fracture that is fine within the bone, in the subtlety of the small hair, and for this reason this type of fracture is called capillary.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	 And it is a fracture that is made either by falling or by the strike of a stone, and similarly, which makes some layer of the bone enter into the divided parts within, and it is made in the concave place, as happens to the earthenware pots when they are struck and are broken from their entrance into the divided parts within.
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	 And this is mainly found in the bones of children, as well as in the heads of infants.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	 And for all these species of fractures that are splinters, they are painful like separated stars.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	 And I will come with a reminder of all this to its place.
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	 And we recognize all these types of fractures through detection on them and by examination with tests and the removal of decaying flesh that is on them.
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	 And the capillary type is recognized because it appears on the bone, it is washed and then examined with a probe, for the fracture looks black.
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	 But in the treatment of fractures, consider first the symptoms of the patient, and if you see through the symptoms an evident sign of fear, such as vomiting from anger, fainting, loss of consciousness, loss of voice, syncope, acute fever, discharge from the eyes and redness of them, similar to these symptoms in major constitutions, without doubt he will not be cured.
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	 And if you see non-serious symptoms, you hope for recovery, then you begin the treatment of him.

E si le pannicol es retangut quan tu erradiques le os, lahoras cove que prenguas drap de li segon la quantitat de la plagua, e submergeys aquel en oli rozat, e pausa aquel sobre le orrifici de la plagua; e aprop pren autre drap doblat o triplicat e submergeys lu en vi e oli rozat e pausa aquel sobre drap prim e fay aquo al pus leugierament que podes sobre aquel, que no graves le ciphac; e aprop administra sobre aquel liament lat, e no strenhas aquel sino per quantitat que tengua la plagua tant solament.	 "And if the skin is cut when you remove the bone, then take cloth according to the size of the wound and soak it in rose oil, and place it on the opening of the wound; and then take another folded or tripled cloth and soak it in wine and rose oil and place it on top of the first cloth, and do this as lightly as possible so that you do not press too hard; and then administer a bandage with lard, and do not tighten it more than is necessary for the wound alone.
E layssa aquel am aquesta cura per un dia o per dos entro que sias segur de apostema caut; e aprop deslia aquel e aprop aministra medicinas am las quals es superflua siccitat, ayssi cum razitz de lin e farina de errs, e polvera de enses e de aristologia, e de semblantz ad aquels.	 "And leave it with this care for one day or two until you are sure that the abscess is cauterized; and then unbind it and administer medicines which have a superfluous dryness, such as linseed oil and powdered iris root, and poppy seeds and similar things.
E es que tu fassas de aquestas medicinas polvera que sia pulverizada sobre la plagua, ayssi cum son secas; e universalment, administra en aquel tota medicina de proprietat de la qual es que abstergesca e no mordique.	 And it is that you make a powder from these medications, which should be sprinkled on the wound as they are dry; and generally, administer all medicine of such a nature that it cleanses and does not cause pain.
E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.	 And be careful according to your skill that the wound in your care is clean; and do not allow it to have any scab or other; nor let it accumulate pus in it; for when it is confined beneath the skin, it corrupts it and poisons it, and causes in the patient a malignant disease.
E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte.	 And it happens in the vault of the skull, when the bone is exposed and especially if its care has been neglected, and it turns black on its surface; and therefore consider whether these accidents happen to the patient, for you should know that it is very harmful without any doubt.
E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas iii, e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat.	 And if there is no blackness except from the medication that has been applied on it, and it is due to that medication that this blackness occurs, then you should take one part of honey and three parts of olive oil, and with these moisten a cloth, and then place it on the vault; and then care for it with the necessary curative herbs until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	 Chapter III
De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	 Of the restoration of the nose when it is crushed.
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.	 Know that the nose is not broken but rather divided into two parts at once, the upper and lower, or one of these parts may be displaced, because there are two bones in it, and the lower part is cartilaginous and cannot be broken; only contusion, distortion, and curvature occur.
Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.	 But if one of the two parts is broken, then you must insert your little finger into the nose and close the fracture from inside with your index finger, and with your thumb from outside, until the nose returns to its natural shape.
E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.	 And you should do this gently, being careful not to cause pain to the patient during your operation.
E si la fractura es en la pus sobirana partida del nas, e le dit no perve ad aquela, lahoras cove que sia equat am la extremitat del ray en le qual sia petita grossitut.	 And if the fracture is in the upper part of the nose and your finger cannot reach it, then it must be equalized with the tip of a reed that has a small thickness.
E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.	 And if the fracture is in both parts, then you should do the same thing.
E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut.	 And take care to restore it on the first day of the fracture, if possible; and if not, then you should wait for the abscess to heal after seven or ten days.
E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas.	 And then insert a piece of linen cloth into the end of the nose, if the fracture is in one place, or put two pieces, if the fracture is in two places, and let it be thick enough to fill the hole in the nose.
E diysso alcus dels antics restauradors que las calguas sian enfundudas en boder, e sian permudadas en tot dia, mays no es vist a mi; habantz cove que la meca sia enfunduda en album de huou comfit am polvera de moli; e aprop layssa la qualgua entro que l’os sia fermat e sia endurazida la cartillage.	 And so say some of the ancient restorers that the pieces should be wrapped in fat and changed daily, but I have not seen this. It is necessary for the piece to be wrapped in egg white mixed with powdered bone; and then leave the piece inside until the bone is set and the cartilage has hardened.
E alcunas veguadas sia entromes en le nas, en loc de calgua, pena de auca pus que es envolopada de drap de li leon; e sia que ja te la fractura del nas pus vehement e que le malaute no sia prohibit de inspiracio.	 And sometimes it is inserted into the nose instead of a piece, namely a wooden peg that is wrapped in linen cloth; and let this be done when the nasal fracture is very severe and the patient is not prevented from breathing.
E aquesta causa no es a tu necessaria; e si voles, fay aquo, e si voles, fay calguas.	 And this method is not necessary for you; if you wish, do this, and if you wish, use pieces.
E si accideys autra veguada apostema caut, emplastra le nas am cerot o am coto enfus en vi agre e oli rozat, o am diaquilon.	 And if another time a carbuncle occurs, place a plaster on the nose with wax or cotton soaked in vinegar and rose oil, or with diachylon.
Mays si no accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que emplaustres aquel defora am farina de sizami e am polvera de enses cofitz am album de huou; e aprop pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e no lies le nas am alcuna causa.	 But if a carbuncle does not occur, then it is necessary to plaster the outside with sumac flour and powdered anise mixed with egg white; and then place a linen bandage over it, and do not touch the nose with anything else.
Mays si so trencats les osses del nas am fractura petita o so conminuitz, lahoras cove que scindas sobre aquels, e extraguas aquels am insturmentz que conveno ad aquels; e aprop cos la scissura, e cura aquela am aquo que encarna e consolida, e am emplastres ad aquo convenientz.	 Here's the translation of your given sentence:
E si accideys plagua dedintz le nas, lahoras cove que cures aquela am calguas e administra canulas de plom entro que sia de tot sanat.	 And if a wound occurs inside the nose, then it is necessary to cure that with clips and administer lead cannulas until it is completely healed.
Capitol .iiii.	 Chapter IV.
De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	 The restoration of the jaw when it is dislocated.
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	 When the jaw has been broken and the fracture is not with a wound, consider if the fracture is only on the outside and not broken in two, and it curves at the inner parts, then its diagnosis is easy.
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	 Therefore, if the fracture is on the right side, you should insert your left index finger into the patient's mouth; and likewise, if the fracture is in the left jaw, then insert the index finger of your right hand; and with it, press the swelling of the fracture inside to the outside parts, with your other hand on the outer part of the bone; with that, reduce it.
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu.	 And if the jaw fracture is already separated into two parts, then it is necessary to administer traction of the two parts in line with each other until their approximation becomes possible.
E si accideys conmocio de dentz a disrupcio, lahoras strenh aquelas de las quals speras que romandran am fil de aur o de argent o de ceda; e aprop pausa sobre la mandibula trencada cerot, e aprop pausa sobre lu drap duplicat, e pausa sobre le drap gran stelha decentment fayta, o una pessa de sola engual a la longitut de la mandibula; e aprop lia aquela desus segon que a tu es apparelhada la liadura de lu e que conveneys la applicacio, entro que no es destruida.	 And if there is a loosening of the teeth to the point of disruption, then strengthen them with gold or silver wire or silk thread; and place wax over the broken jaw, and place a double cloth over it, and place a well-made large starched cloth over that, or a sole of leather equal in length to the jaw; and secure it above according to how you are skilled in bandaging and apply it conveniently, so that it is not disrupted.
E comanda al malaute que use de repaus e tranquilitat, e pausa la vianda de lu sorbicios leons.	 And order the patient to rest and remain calm, and give them light and simple food.
E si extimas que ja es alterada la figura en alcuna manieyra, lahoras tu te coyta e deslia aquel al tertz dia; e aprop rectifica aquo que ja es alterat de lu e emplaustra aquel am polvera de moli, am album de huou, o am farina de cisami, pus que tu auras ostat le cerot de lu, e pausa sobre le emplastra lana leon.	 And if you think that the shape has already been altered in any way, then remove it on the third day; and afterward rectify what has been altered and apply a plaster made of powdered bran, egg white, or samolina flour, after removing the cerot from him, and place clean wool over the plaster.
E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.	 And when this plaster is attached and adjusted to him, and the bone's position has not been altered, leave it in place until he is healed and the fracture strengthens; for many times this fracture is healed within three weeks.
E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema.	 And if an abscess occurs again, then administer what has been said many times for his treatment until he is healed and the abscess is removed.
E si la fractura es am plagua, lahoras considera si es pessa del os separada o satagias, lahoras tu te subtilia que ostes aquelas satagias am aquo que conveneys ad aquo en la remocio de aquelas dels sturmentz.	 And if the fracture is with a wound, then consider if it is a piece of bone that has become separated or splinters; then you should be careful to remove those splinters using what is appropriate for removing such fragments from instruments.
E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	 And if the opening of the wound is narrow, then you should widen it using a fleam according to your need.
E aprop quan tu auras ostat aquelas satagias, e de aquelas no sira remaugut re, lahoras tu cos le orrifici de la plagua si es ampla; e sino, pausa sobre aquela un dels emplaustres que conveneysso ad aquo e encarnan aquela, entro que sia sanada.	 When you have removed those splinters, and nothing remains of them, then sew up the orifice of the wound if it is large; otherwise, place one of the suitable plasters on it that will help heal it until it is healed.
Capitol .v.	 Chapter 5
De restauracio de la furcula quan es trinquada.	 On restoring the collarbone when it is broken.
Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquela fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.	 Often the collarbone is broken from its front side due to a muscle and this break can occur in one of three ways.
Quar o es trencada, o seperada, o es seperada en doas partz otra que no accidan satagias; e es leugier a la restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que accideysso en lu satagias, e es dificil a restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que la fractura es am plagua.	 Because it is either broken, separated, or broken into two parts without splinters; and the restoration of it is easy; or it happens that there are splinters in it, and its restoration is difficult; or it happens that the break is with a wound.
E la operacio en aquela, quan la fractura es ses plagua, es que tu fassas esser present dos ministres, per so que la un tengua le adjutori e siegua la furcula trencada, e l’autre extenda le col ves aquela partida.	 And the operation in that case, when the fracture is without a wound, is to have two assistants present, so that one holds and follows the broken collarbone, and the other extends the neck towards that side.
E aprop enguala la fractura am les tieus ditz entro que sia fayta la forma de lu segon que cove, e no sia en lu eminencia pauca ni concavitat.	 And then gently close the fracture with your fingers until it is formed correctly according to its shape and there are no prominent parts or concavities.
E si indigeysses mes de extencio, lahoras cove que pauses dejos le titillic del malaute spera de drap o de lana, e sia la grandesa de lu segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat; e exten e eleva la furcula e coarta la spera am la tua ma entro que enguales la frectura segon que cove.	 And if you need more extension, then place a pad of cloth or wool under the patient's heel, and its size should be according to your necessity; then extend and raise the ankle and press the pad with your hand until it aligns the fracture as needed.
E si no podes atirar la extremitat de la furcula a las partidas defora, per so quar es pervenguda al preon, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e pauses sobre le muscle de lu un coyssi migier en grandeza.	 And if you cannot pull the extremity of the ankle to its original position because it has turned inward, then the patient should be placed supine on their back, and place a cushion of medium size over their calf muscle.
E le ministre prema le muscle de lu a las partidas dejos entro que l’os de la furcula sia elevat que es en le preon en sus, e lahoras tu rectifique la fractura e enguala aquela am les tieus ditz.	 And the assistant should press the patient's calf muscle back into its original position until the bone of the ankle is raised and comes out of the inverted position; then you straighten the fracture and align it with your fingers.
Mays si sentes satagias de la furcula e so maugudas, lahoras cove que fendes sobre aquela e extraguas aquelas satagias am facilitat.	 But if you feel bone splinters from the ankle and they are prominent, then it is necessary to make an incision over that area and remove those splinters easily.
E si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu ingenia inscisio de lu am un dels inscissoris les quals has apparelhatz ad aquo, pus que havias pausat dejos la furcula le sturment que serve le ciphac; e es sturment de fust o de ferr del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	 And if it is stuck in the bone, then make an incision with one of the scalpels that you have prepared for this purpose, after placing under the ankle the instrument that serves as a splint; and this instrument is made of wood or iron, and this is its shape:
E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	 And it is similar to a cup, whose this is the hollow part; and its size should be according to what you need from it, depending on the bigness of the bone or the smallness of it.
Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	 "But the length of it should be according to what is possible for the operation; so that there are two ends, one wide and the other narrow.
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	 "And if the wound that you have cut when you have extracted the arrow from the bone is wide, and you are certain of pus, then you should bring the two lips of the wound together with stitches.
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	 "And if the wound is small, or you fear certain pus, then fill the wound with cloth and powder according to the extent of the wound's opening.
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	 "And if certain pus occurs, then infuse a cloth with vinegar and rose oil and wine, and place it on that.
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	 "But the narrowing of the bone when there is no wound and no cut, it is that you place a paste made from flour of wheat and egg white on it, and place a stopper on it, and then place the blade under the tongue of the patient, if he needs it, and then take a humeral bandage, which is what they call mot long in Arabic, and let its length be one palm or around that; and then place double layers of powder over the stopper and the paste; and then take a thin board about three handbreadths long and of similar length; and then wrap that board in cloth, and then wrap that cloth with the board on the fracture site; and then place humeral bandages as it is wrapped, and wrap it around the neck of the patient and under his tongue and behind his back, and reduce it over the entire area, and whenever the narrowing of the fracture with narrowing descends, and this is not hidden from you.
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	 And thus, make sure that the bandage is not too tight over the broken bone; and for this reason, it is necessary for you to see the patient every day. When the bandage becomes softened or you notice that the bone has moved, then you should adjust it and strengthen the bandage.
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	 And then place the patient's head on their chest, and put a small pillow under their neck at night; so that with this, the helper's aid to the side of the patient is elevated, and thus the fracture of the furcula (wishbone) is raised by the muscle's elevation; or tie the patient's arm to their chest.
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	 And do not untie the bandage unless swelling or pus appears in the place, within twelve days.
E aprop renovelha le emplastre si has vista la facia de lu ad aquo, e ajusta en la strictura e restaura aquel e layssa entro que sia restaurat e sia coagulat la fractura de la furcula.	 And then renew the poultice if you see that the face of it is towards this, and adjust it in the narrow part and restore it, and leave it until the fracture of the furcula is restored and coagulated.
E es strenguda e comfortada segon le mes en xxviii dias, e alcunas veguadas en alcus homes es fayt en mens de temps de aquel.	 And it is strengthened and made comfortable according to the moon in twenty-eight days, and sometimes in some men it is done in less time than that.

Capitol .vii.	 "Chapter VII.
De restauracio de la fractura del pietz.	 "On the healing of a foot fracture.
Le pietz alcunas veguadas es romput en le mieg loc de lu e aquo tart endeve; mays las extremitatz de lu mot endeve que so ciccadas e comminuidas.	 "The foot sometimes breaks in the middle and it heals late; but the ends of it move too much and are shattered and crushed.
E dels accidentz de lu quan es trencat le mieg de lu es que declina a las partidas dedintz e accideys a lu gran dolor, e dificultat en lo hale, e tos, e fort leu e vomeys sanc; e es declarada en lu cavitat en le os trencat e no es occulta al sentiment.	 "And the consequences of this are that when it breaks in the middle, it inclines towards the inner parts and causes great pain, difficulty in breathing, coughing, fever, and vomiting blood; and the cavity in the broken bone is evident to touch.
E la restauracio de lu es que sia resupinat le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa entre las spallas de lu un coyssi; e aprop prem als muscles de lu, e ajusta las costas de lu am las mas de dos costatz, e subtilia te en la operacio de lu e en la equacio segon tota manieyra que es ad aquo possibla e que conveneys ad aquo, entro que retorne la figura del os segon que cove.	 "And its healing is that the patient be placed supine on their back, and a cushion be placed between their shoulders; then press the muscles of the patient, and adjust the ribs of the patient with the hands of two assistants, and be skillful in the operation of it and in the position according to every manner that is possible and that is suitable for it, until the shape of the bone returns as needed.

Capitol .x.	 Capítulo 10.
De restauracio de la ancha.	 Sobre la restauración de la hinchazón.
