And sometimes swelling occurs in the last of the vertebrae of the back, and it is believed that this is due to dislocation; and it is that bone which has already swollen, so it is not advisable to make an incision on it with this medicine, for it will cause you to die.
Capitol .xxxi.	 Chapter 31
De curacio de anca dislocada.	 On the treatment of dislocated hips.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	 Know that the hip joint and the muscle joint are considered only as dislocations, and not what happens to other small joints with slight displacement and concavity.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	 And the hip joint can be dislocated in four ways, either to the inner parts, or to the outer parts, or to the front parts, or to the back parts.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	 And it is most commonly dislocated towards the inner parts, and rarely towards the front or the back.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	 Here is the translation of your sentence:
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	 And the sign of someone who has experienced dislocation is that the affected parts are moved outward, indicating that this condition opposes other conditions.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	 And the sign of dislocation occurring in front is that the affected thigh extends according to its length, but without bending it unless there is pain in the joint; and if one tries to walk and cannot, then it is dislocation in front; and his urine is retained and he has a swelling, and you should make him walk on his heels.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	 And the sign of dislocation occurring in back is that the joint does not extend, nor can it bend as much as the other side; and the thigh is shorter than the other, and the knee is swollen, and you should bring the head of the femur to its place.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	 However, the reduction of these types of dislocation depends on whether you consider it to be old and chronic, in which case it is better not to attempt reduction immediately but rather to let it remain in its current position; in such cases, immediate action is not necessary.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	 But in the case of recent dislocation, which is one of the four types of dislocation, you should turn the joint and extend it towards the inside and towards the outside, to the right and to the left, for quickly returns and does not require any other treatment.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	 Here's the line-by-line translation of the given sentence:
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	 This appears to be describing a procedure involving stretching or extending the patient's body. Let's break it down:
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	 And let the extension of all of them be in one go, until the patient is raised from the ground and remains suspended.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	 And this type of extension is common to all four [limbs].
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	 And therefore if the dislocation returns as we have said, it will be good; and if not, then all sorts of things must be done for the proper treatment.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	 In the reduction of itself, when it is dislocated and the dislocation is in the interior parts, it is necessary that the patient be placed supine on their back; and then place the straps on the front of the thigh at the point between the head of the thigh and the location that is below the groin; and then extend the strap above the groin to the highest part of the fork.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	 And then another strong minister should take the arms of the patient, and firmly grasp the thick part of the injured thigh and extend it outward with great force, because that returns to its place.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	 And this is a lighter treatment by which this member is reduced than the others.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	 But if it is resistant to you and does not obey the treatment with this type of cure entirely, then it is necessary that both feet of the patient be tied together strongly but lightly on both heels and both soles.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	 And let the length of each be by the quantity of four words, and let the sick leg be extended more than the other by a quantity of two words.

E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	 And immediately command a strong young man to cut off the head of the cushion, and let another young man be suspended with the patient, and let the other young man pull the cushion with strength, because the joint returns to its place quickly.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	 But in the proper reduction, when it is a dislocation outward from its original position, it is necessary that the patient lies on his back as we have recommended when they are swollen; and let the bandage be tightened strongly over the sick leg specifically and over their feet.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	 And immediately two posts should be placed: one under their feet, and the other under their head; and let the drape be wrapped around adjusted posts placed in the middle of the bed, so that the patient is not injured because the post is between their thighs, for you must ensure that the extension to the sides does not pull.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	 And then each assistant stretches out on their side, and the physician with his hand guides the reduction according to art.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	 Therefore, if it obeys the reversal, it will be good; and if not, press firmly on that spot and in this manner as we have said in gentleness for that guidance.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	 But make sure the patient lies flat on their back quietly.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	 And when the dislocation is in front of the joint, it is necessary that the leg be slightly extended; and it is according to this same story placed on the stump; and the physician places the palm of his right hand on the patient's ankle, and then pulls that with the other hand, and with that pulling presses that which is extended behind towards the inner part of the knee.  />
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	 And if the dislocation is behind the joint, then it is not necessary for the patient to be extended backwards and raised off the ground; rather, it is better that he be placed on a hard surface, as is appropriate for elevation if his hip is dislocated towards the outside, as we have said about placing him over two hips; and it is on its face with its limbs extended, as we have said, it has no difference.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	 And it is necessary that a compress with a board be placed over the joint area.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre. E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	 Then promptly remove the bandage and the plaster, and compare one leg with the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	 At that moment, if you see those hips equally, then know that the dislocation is already healed, and then let the patient go.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	 And if you see any cause of softening, then return and plaster that area, and extract it according to your first structure, and leave it for three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	 Then promptly remove that, and make the patient delay in walking on each foot for several days, until they are comfortable.
Capitol .xxxii.	 Chapter .32
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	 About the cure for dislocation of the shoulder.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	 The shoulder is dislocated in three ways: it can be dislocated to the front parts outside, and to the front parts inside, and more towards the back parts than the front parts; and it cannot be dislocated to the front parts.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	 And the sign of its dislocation is that you command the patient to apply his leg with his thigh; then you know that the shoulder is dislocated.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	 And the restoration of all its ways is that you make the patient lie down straight, so that he can extend his leg if possible; adhere your back to his face, and place his foot between your feet; then make the shoulder adhere with your palms, and hold those between your said parts over his shoulder with strength, and another assistant extends his foot until the shoulder returns to its place.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	 And the sign of reduction is that his leg adheres to his thigh with effortless lightness.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	 Then bandage it and make the thigh adhere to the leg, and then bind them together at the same time with a bandage for three or four days, and then unbind them.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	 And do not use the patient for walking for some days, until they are healed and strengthened.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	 But if the reduction of him to you is difficult, then administer strong extension with bandages as described in the treatment of the hip.
Capitol .xxxiii.	 Chapter 33.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	 Of the treatment of dislocation of the ankle.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	 The ankle is sometimes displaced by slight movement, and sometimes it is dislocated suddenly, and the dislocation occurs either at the inner or outer parts.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	 And the sign of its dislocation is that you see the ankle swelling towards the side to which it is dislocated.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	 But the treatment of its slight displacement is easy recovery, which is that it should be extended with ease by hand and wrapped until it returns.
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	 But in the treatment of it when suddenly dislocated, it is necessary for you to stop the patient straight, and let him have a strong and vigorous servant behind his back in the middle of him.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	 And then you should take with your right hand the foot from the upper side, and with your left hand from the lower side of the foot at the ankle.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	 And then pull the foot towards you with your right hand, and then twice more with the left hand, and then extend it with the left hand; and press the soles of the foot with the right hand below the knee without effort.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	 And do this two times as we have described.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	 And then press the soles of the foot to the calf the third time, and you are at the ankle.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	 Therefore, if it returns once or twice in this manner, and you see the foot swollen, that is good; but if not, then repeat the operation on him, because it will return.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	 But if it is forbidden for you to reduce him with what we have recommended, then make the patient lie on their back on the ground, and place a strong rope on the ground, and let it slip between his thighs, and you have already wrapped cloth around him so that the patient does not hurt.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	 And then let the servant hold his thighs, and then another servant extend the foot with their hands or with a band that lies on the top of the foot; and then let each servant extend against the extension of their partner, and let the rope be extended between the patient's thighs holding him, so that his body is not pulled to the sides beyond its extension.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	 And immediately the physician reduces the dislocation with his hands, while another assistant holds the healthy side below, because the dislocation returns easily.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	 And once the dislocation has returned and its healing reduction is evident to you, then place a plaster and fasten it strongly with bandages, and bind the foot to the leg with a bandage.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	 And you should be careful or guard against the nerves that are behind the ankle, so that the bandage over them is not too tight and does not press on them strongly.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	 And then leave it alone for two days or three; and if the bandage is softened, remove it.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	 And then unbind him on the third day or the fourth, and forbid the patient from moving for forty days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	 But if he is forced to move during that time, it is not certain that the dislocation will not be dissolved and ruined on him, and then it will not receive healing.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	 And if an abscess occurs to him, then you should administer to him the treatment that we have described earlier in another place of treatment and application, until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	 **Chapter 34**
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	 **On the Treatment of Dislocation of Toes.**
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	 **It is recommended that the dislocated toe be bandaged with little tension without struggle; and this is not difficult, but rather easy.**
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	 **However, if the dislocation is in any of the toes of the foot, then it is necessary for you to make the patient sit on a bench or table, and have him stand as if he were walking.**
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	 **And then you should stand on the foot of the patient and place your foot over where you think the joint is, and then press down firmly with your foot until it returns to its proper position, and you see that it is bandaged and does not appear prominent.**
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	 **And then place under the sole of the patient's foot a board that supports the entire foot, which has two ends, and then bind it with decent and firm strength for three days; and then unbind it and make the patient rest from walking for several days, until it is strengthened and healing is assured.**
Capitol .xxxv.	 **Chapter 35**
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	 **On the Types of Dislocation that may be caused by a Wound or Fracture or Both.**
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	 When some of these causes occur and you endeavor in the treatment of it and the restoration of him, many times death follows.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	 And for that reason it is not proper to presume over his treatment except by someone who is wise in the art, with long experience, compassionate and merciful, slow, not hasty or presumptuous; and who uses in the beginning medicines that check inflammations cautiously, and leaves the patient to divine judgment unless you expect recovery from destruction, and with relief of the illness, and in which some hope appears.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	 And therefore strive first to bring about his reduction at the beginning of the cause, before it becomes an inflammation.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	 And then if the member returns as we wish, administer a regimen that will check inflammation and cure the wound with what is appropriate from the drying ointments.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	 And if there is dislocation with fracture and the bones are separated, then you should attempt to bring them together, and do what we have said in the cases of simple injuries that preceded these places.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	 And beware and avoid according to your ability that which leads to the paths of fear as I have predicted for you; for this is better for you, more lasting to your glory, and healthier for your true body in your time.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	 Here's a line-by-line translation of the given text:
